metadata.Title: CVE-2019-3902 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in Mercurial before 4.9. It was possible to use symlinks and subrepositories to defeat Mercurial's path-checking logic and write files outside a repository. It was discovered that Mercurial mishandled symlinks in subrepositories. An attacker could use this vulnerability to write arbitrary files to the target's filesystem.

criterions.comment: mercurial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
